rioko.eclipse.registry

Class RegistryManagement

  • java.lang.Object
    • rioko.eclipse.registry.RegistryManagement

  • public class RegistryManagement
extends java.lang.Object
    Static class with some methods used to Manage the Eclipse Registry. It allow to get Attributes from an extension point or instantiate the java objects declared in the registry.
    Author:
    Antonio

    • Method Detail

      • getElementsFor

        public static org.eclipse.core.runtime.IConfigurationElement[] getElementsFor(java.lang.String extensionId)
        Generic method to get the Eclipse Registry Elements given a extension id.
        Parameters:
        extensionId - Name of the extension we want to get.
        Returns:
        an Array of IConfigurationElement with the elements required

      • existsId

        public static java.lang.Boolean existsId(java.lang.String extensionId)
        Method to know if exist some elements for an extension point id.
        Parameters:
        extensionId - Name of the extension we want to check.
        Returns:
        Boolean with true if there is an element in the registry with that extension ID

      • getAttribute

        public static java.lang.String getAttribute(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IConfigurationElement element,
                                            java.lang.String attribute)
        Method to get the attribute of a Eclipse Registry Element. If it does not exist, returns null. Avoid the exception thrown by the IConfigurationElement method.
        Parameters:
        element - Eclipse Registry element to search
        attribute - Name of the attribute we want to get
        Returns:
        String associated with attribute in element or null if it does not exist

      • existsAttribute

        public static java.lang.Boolean existsAttribute(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IConfigurationElement element,
                                                java.lang.String attribute)
        Method to know if a element of the Eclipse Registry have an attribute defined.
        Parameters:
        element - Element where we are going to look into
        attribute - Name of the attribute we want to search
        Returns:
        Boolean indicating if element exists in element

      • getInstanciableElements

        public static java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getInstanciableElements(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IConfigurationElement element)
        Method to get the names of the attributes which are instanciable
        Parameters:
        element - Eclipse Registry Element where we want to get the instanciable elements
        Returns:
        A Collection with the names of the instanciable attributes

      • isInstanciable

        public static java.lang.Boolean isInstanciable(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IConfigurationElement element)
        Method to know if an element has any attribute instanciable
        Parameters:
        element - Eclipse Registry Element where we want to check
        Returns:
        Boolean with true if there is an instanciable attribute

      • isIntanciable

        public static java.lang.Boolean isIntanciable(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IConfigurationElement element,
                                              java.lang.String attributeName)
        Method to know if an attribute of an Eclipse Registry Element is instanciable
        Parameters:
        element - Eclipse Registry Element where we want to check
        attributeName - String with the name of the attribute we want to check
        Returns:
        Boolean with true if the attributeName is instanciable for element

      • getInstance

        public static java.lang.Object getInstance(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IConfigurationElement element,
                                           java.lang.String attributeName)
        Method to get a new instance of the attribute. Return null if it is not instanciable.
        Parameters:
        element - The Eclipse Registry Element we want to use
        attributeName - String with the name of the attribute we want to instantiate.
        Returns:
        Object with the new instance or null if attributeName is not instantiable in element

      • getInstances

        public static java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object> getInstances(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IConfigurationElement element)
        Method to get all the objects instantiables of an element of Eclipse Regsitry
        Parameters:
        element - Eclipse Registry Element we want to fully instantiate
        Returns:
        Collection of Object with the instances possible. It has no null elements and can be an empty collection

      • getInstanceOf

        public static <T> T getInstanceOf(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IConfigurationElement element,
                                  java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Method to get the first instance of a class from an element. It search throught the instanciable elements and return the first element of the class provided. It is possible give an abstract class and this method returns the first object that extends that abstract class, i.e., this method does not use the constructor of the class given.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class we want to search used as a parameter of this method.
        Parameters:
        element - Eclipse Registry Element we want to use
        clazz - Class we want to instantiate.
        Returns:
        The instance of the object casted to the class given or null if there is no instance of that class.

      • haveInstancesOf

        public static <T> java.lang.Boolean haveInstancesOf(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IConfigurationElement element,
                                                    java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Method to know if there is any instantiable object of a certain class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class we want to check used as a parameter of this method.
        Parameters:
        element - Eclipse Registry Element we want to check
        clazz - Class we want to search
        Returns:
        Boolean with true if there is a instance of the class given

      • getInstancesOf

        public static <T> java.util.Collection<T> getInstancesOf(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IConfigurationElement element,
                                                         java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Method to get all the instances that extend a given class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class we want to instantiate used as a parameter of this method.
        Parameters:
        element - Eclipse Registry Element we want to use
        clazz - Class we want to get
        Returns:
        A Collection of Objects that extends clazz and are instantiated by element.

      • getInstance

        public static java.lang.Object getInstance(java.lang.String extensionId,
                                           java.lang.String className)
        Method to get an instance of a class in an extension point using its class canonical name
        Parameters:
        extensionId - Identifier of the extension point where we want to search
        className - Canonical name of the class we want to instantiate
        Returns:
        Object of the instance desired if exists and null otherwise

      • getInstances

        public static java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object> getInstances(java.lang.String extensionId,
                                                                  java.lang.String className)
        Method to get all the instances of a certain class in an extension point.
        Parameters:
        extensionId - Identifier of the extension point where we want to search
        className - Canonical name of the class we want to instantiate
        Returns:
        Collection of Objects that are instances of the desired class existing in the extensionId provided

      • getInstanceOf

        public static <T> T getInstanceOf(java.lang.String extensionId,
                                  java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Method analogous to getInstance(String, String) but now recieves the Class object instead its canonical name. This allows to return subclasses of the given class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class we want to instantiate used as a parameter of this method.
        Parameters:
        extensionId - Identifier of the extension point where we want to search
        clazz - Class we want to find
        Returns:
        An object that extends the class given.

      • getInstancesOf

        public static <T> java.util.Collection<T> getInstancesOf(java.lang.String extensionId,
                                                         java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Method that returns all the objects that are instantiable in an extension point and extend the class given.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class we want to instantiate used as a parameter of this method.
        Parameters:
        extensionId - Identifier of the extension point where we want to search
        clazz - Class we want to find
        Returns:
        Collection of Objects that extend the class given that are instantiable in the extensionId
